inclusion.criterion: Established diagnosis of COPD with FEV1 <60% predicted
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: Patients of both genders will be included
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: IRB approved written informed consent will be obtained from each subject
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Known hypersensitivity to beta agonists, theophylline, steroids, or roflumilast
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Current or recent (<2 weeks) treatment with oral steroids, theophylline or other methylxanthines, or roflumlast
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has a history of asthma for 3 years, but his symptoms improve within 1-2 hours outside the workplace. He currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg.
